I'm working on https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/58713 and I've gotten to the point where I have enough functionality working that I'm starting to write tests for it. I'm using a run-make test, and I'm getting unexpected results from the test: it compiles and links successfully, but it produces unexpected output. I'd like to inspect the resulting .exe file (I'm on Windows), but the test harness deletes it on exit. Is there a flag I can pass to x.py test to ask the test system to leave the temporary directory intact?

EDIT: never mind (sheepishly). The problem isn't that the temp directory was getting deleted; I was looking for it in the wrong place. Sorry for the noise!
